text:
Mathematical Reflection

In this unit, we use proportional relationships to investigate probability and solve problems. At the end of this investigation, ask yourself:

What do you know about probability? About proportional relationship?

At this point, students can

  • find experimental probabilities.
  • use the outcome of experimental probabilities to make or estimate predictions.
  • make decisions about the amount of data used in an experimental probability and if it is sufficient to make predictions.
  • write a probability as a ration of favorable outcomes to total outcomes.
